title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography

snippet: After inspecting with great pleasure the machinery connected with thefoundry, we took our leave and returned to Edinburgh by steamer fromAlloa.

title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: From Stirling we walked to Alloa, passing the picturesque cascadesrushing down the cleft's of the Ochils.

title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: We started from Newhaven by a small steamboat,passing, on our way up the Firth, Queensferry, Culross, and Alloa.

title: Salute to Adventurers
author: Buchan, John
snippet: My uncle had sentout a quantity of Ayrshire cheeses, mutton hams, pickled salmon,Dunfermline linens, Paisley dimity, Alloa worsted, sweet ale fromTranent, Kilmarnock cowls, and a lot of fine feather-beds from theClydeside.

title: Europe from May to December,
author: Williams, Rudolph.
snippet: The distance to Alloa, as the pigeon flies, is six miles from Stirling, while by river it is nineteen, and the two are connected by the river.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: It now strikes off into the interior to Thornton Junction, from which the Dunfermline,  Alloa, and Stirling line diverges.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Excursions may be made from this to DouNE, 5 miles; to Rumbling Biudge.IT miles; to Alloa, 7 mOes; to Akdoch, 9 mUes; To Callander, 13 mUes; to Abereoyle, 18 miles.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: "Being once benighted when out a hunting, and separated from his attendants,  he happened to enter a cottage in the midst of a moor, at the foot of the Ochil hills, near Alloa, where, unknown, he was kindly received.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the same side as Alloa, and a little to the westward, is Tullibody House, a residence of the Abercromby family.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The distance by land from Alloa to Stirling Bridge is only six miles, while by water it is twelve.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: At Alloa commence those remarkable windings  called the " Links of Forth."

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: About a mile beyond Clackmannan,  and in the neighbourhood of extensive collieries and distilleries, is the town of Alloa [Inns: Royal Oak Hotel; Crown Inn; Ship Inn.] Near the town, and in the midst of a fine park, stands Alloa House, the ancient seat of the family of Erskine, Earls of IMar, and the subject of a fine Scottish air.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Steamboats sail for Alloa and Stirling every day from Granton Pier.

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: — Went home from Alloa by Dumblane, a very pretty town and over the Brig of Ardor, and by Auctor- Ardor to the

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: In the afternoon passed the Firth by Stirling bridge and went five miles by the bottom of the hills to Alloa in Clackmannanshire, the seat of Lord Erskine, at present the house is but indifferent, but there was a great plan begun by Lord Mar for making it a very fine place.

title: A bachelor's rambles through the British Isles.
author: Butler, Charles J.
snippet: We passed over the Forth bridge and through Alloa, a town of considerable size, having the appearance of being quite a business place.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: He was born at Alloa, in 1744, and educated through the kindness of some generous ladies.
